intro: Angiopteris angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marattiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery fronds that are typically less than 1 meter in length. The plant thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and marshes, where it can anchor itself to submerged substrates. Its sporangia are clustered in sori on the underside of the fronds, a typical feature of ferns. Angiopteris angustata plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
